intro: Artemisia roxburghiana var. roxburghiana, commonly known as blue haze or blue artemisia, is a perennial shrub native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage that emits a strong, camphor-like scent. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flower heads that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
